question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Loop Flag Injection] Can an attacker craft loop_unroll values that cause Boogie command injection through the -loopUnroll flag formatting? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: stable_test_output] [Concurrency Bypass] Does forcing proc_cores to 1 when stable_test_output is true reduce verification coverage by disabling parallel verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Determinism Exploitation] Can an attacker exploit stable_test_output mode to make verification deterministic and predictable, helping them craft verification bypasses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Flag Order Attack] Can the order of flags in the constructed command be exploited where later flags override earlier security-critical flags? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Empty Path Validation] Does the function properly handle empty strings in boogie_exe after checking all paths with is_empty(), or can empty-but-whitespace strings bypass validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Array Axiom Bypass] Can disabling -useArrayAxioms through use_smt_array_theory=false create unsoundness in array operation verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [VCS Cores Bypass] Can setting proc_cores to 0 bypass the vcsCores validation and cause division by zero or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_version()] [Error Suppression] Does the function properly propagate Command execution errors, or can silent failures cause invalid tools to appear valid? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: check_version_is_compatible()] [Missing Error Context] Do version mismatch errors provide sufficient information to detect spoofing attempts, or can attackers hide malicious tools behind version errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: check_version_le()] [Inconsistent Error Messages] Can error message generation leak information about internal version checking logic that helps attackers craft bypasses? (Low)
